page.title: 09MOVING ABOUT IN COOKLEY
page.content: Transport in the area for those without a car is very difficult. Although the village is very near the town of {Kidderminster}with its bus station and British Rail station, Cookley is rather isolated. The main Wolverhampton road passes nearby,but only one bus service uses it. A bus runs from Cookley to Kidderminster rather infrequently and it is very expensive, especially for a family. As a result many of the children rarely visit Kidderminster or the larger areas of population, such as Wolverhampton and Birmingham which are easily accessible by car, and are thus denied access to museums,art galleries and cinemas etc.
